channel.title: Preventing Nulled Accounts [PI]
channel.description:
Hey, I'm new here. I thought I'd throw a quick and easy [b]tutorial[/b] at you!
Alright, so are you tired of accounts getting nulled because they are going in the wrong area? Well I'm going to help you prevent that!
[b]Note:[/b] This is being made on the spot. So if you get errors, let me know, A.S.A.P.! All it is, is a public boolean. (That I'm going to explain.)
Here is the code: [code] (tab)public boolean UnsafeArea() { (tab)(tab)if((absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####) == false) { (tab)(tab)c.getPA().movePlayer(XXXX, YYYY, H); (tab)} (tab)break; [/code]
Where to put the coords you don't want people going out of: [code] (absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####) [/code]
Replace the first '####' with your smallest X coord. Replace the second '####' with the biggest X coord. Replace the third '####' with the smallest Y coord. Replace the last '####' with the biggest Y coord.
Now the area to teleport to: [code] c.getPA().movePlayer(XXXX, YYYY, H); [/code] Replace the coords with the place you want the player to teleport to.
[b]REMINDER:[/b] This was made off the top of my head. Sorry if errors pop up. Let me know if they do. [b]CREDITS:[/b] ME - 100%

item.title: Preventing Nulled Accounts [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

LOLOLOLOLOLOL
Instead of closing the boolean with a } bracket he used break;
:FACEPALM:

Also , the boolean doesn’t return anything , so why not use a void?
And codes like these have to be ran through simultaneously by calling it from the process() method (which is a bad thing , but you also didn’t explain where to put it).

Read full topic

item.title: Preventing Nulled Accounts [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Steven™, post:7, topic:412653”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=514131.msg3731583#msg3731583 date=1314657562]
How does this stop nulled accounts? There are so many places to get nulled. Not even worthy of a snippet gtfo.

kinda like tut bro.

loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooool no.
[/quote]
It stops people from going into un-wanted areas. You know, the one’s that null accounts?[/quote]
Why not just find the places that null the accounts, and add it…

Read full topic

item.title: Preventing Nulled Accounts [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Steven2 Steven™
item.description:
@Steven2 wrote:

Hey, I’m new here. I thought I’d throw a quick and easy tutorial at you!

Alright, so are you tired of accounts getting nulled because they are going in the wrong area? Well I’m going to help you prevent that!

Note: This is being made on the spot. So if you get errors, let me know, A.S.A.P.!
All it is, is a public boolean. (That I’m going to explain.)

Here is the code:

(tab)public boolean UnsafeArea() {
(tab)(tab)if((absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####) == false) {
(tab)(tab)c.getPA().movePlayer(XXXX, YYYY, H);
(tab)}
(tab)break;

Where to put the coords you don’t want people going out of:

(absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####)

Replace the first ‘####’ with your smallest X coord. Replace the second ‘####’ with the biggest X coord. Replace the third ‘####’ with the smallest Y coord. Replace the last ‘####’ with the biggest Y coord.

Now the area to teleport to:

c.getPA().movePlayer(XXXX, YYYY, H);

Replace the coords with the place you want the player to teleport to.

REMINDER: This was made off the top of my head. Sorry if errors pop up. Let me know if they do.
CREDITS:
ME - 100%
